args: Wow—I never woulda thought\nto fight an archer like that!
Ya pick up a few things when there's\nso many skilled fighters around.
I feel like if I studied combat here,\nand passed it on to the people in\nmy village, we'd be invincible...
Whoa, something's really got Rolf spooked.
Wasn't he keeping watch at your village?
At Laranoa's village, in the west forest...
Yes. They only passed through the\nforest, though—there was no indication\nthat they noticed the village was here.
Yes, but we cannot drop our guard.\nThere's no telling when they may return.
As such, Laranoa—I order you to remain in\nthe village and keep watch on the forest.\n...Indefinitely.
With your keen senses and sharpened\nskills, we should be well prepared for\nanything that may happen.
...Indefinitely? So I wouldn't be\nable to go visit the Halidom?
But if you truly care for this village as\nits next chief, you will be willing to put\nits well-being before your own freedom.
You can't just ban her from leaving—\nthat's basically house arrest!
I'm not happy with this either...\nBut what choice do I have?
As the next chief, I humbly accept\nthe task of guarding the village, sir.
But before I take my station, would it be\npossible for me to go say goodbye to\neveryone who helped me at the Halidom?
Hmm... Very well. I shall permit\nyou one night there.
All right guys, let's go. You too Rolf.\nEveryone's gonna wanna see you\none last time.
...Are you really all right with this,\n{player_name}?
That night, the castle held a farewell\nparty for Laranoa and Rolf.
To avoid any emotional good-byes, Laranoa did\nher best to keep the party lively. However...
Look, I get that things are rough\nin the west forest...

But you can't just keep someone from
leaving their village! Like, banishment
is one thing, but reverse banishment?!
She was just getting comfy here, too...
If Laranoa's agreed to the chief's terms,\nthen it's not for us to decide.
But if she's not actually satisfied...
Hm? Is that her over there?
Will you hear me out, Rolf?
It's not like I don't get what the chief\nis saying. I agreed to do what he\nasked, after all.
But I can't help but wonder if this\nis really the right thing to do...
Coming to this castle has taught me that\nthe human world is full of things we don't\nhave in the forest.
If I want to help the village's present,\nthen the chief is probably right:\nI should stay there.
But if I want to help its future,\nI feel like I should...
I think you were on to something there.
If you study the human world, and bring\nwhat you learn back to the village,\nit'll help sylvan society develop.

You've clearly got the village's best
interests in mind, so let's go convince
that old floppy-eared crone to change
his tune!
Do you really think we can?\nI'm not sure what they'll do\nfor a lookout without me...
I might have a solution for that.\nFor now, let's just tell the chief\nwhat you're thinking.
I appreciate what you're doing,\nbut this is my problem, you know?\nI can't—
What good are friends if ya can't rely\non 'em once in a while?
Won't you let us help you realize\nthe future you see for your village?
...Heh. I think I finally get it.
There's nothing wrong with asking\nfor help to achieve your dreams.
In fact, the best leaders do it the most!
So... Will you guys help me?
What do you think we've been sayin'?!\nOf course we'll help.
...I see. You wish to continue\nvisiting the Halidom.
Yes, sir. The human world is full\nof things we don't have here.

And after seeing more of the outside
world, I'm convinced the village would
benefit from incorporating some of 
those things.
So I want to keep learning about human\nsociety, and I think visiting the Halidom\nis the best way to do that.
Understanding human tactics and combat\ntechniques would help if the imperial\narmy ever shows up again, too.
It's like the saying goes: ya gotta know\nyour enemy better than ya know yourself.
Hmm... Strong points all around.\nBut who would watch over the village?
We'll send sentries from the castle,\none at a time. One of our best archers\nwill always be available to you.
If anything happens, we'll back\nyou up with everything we have.
I see... If we have the aid of a prince\nand his army, perhaps we will be\nsafe after all.
Even so, co-existing with another\nrace is no mean feat, Laranoa.
You have your duties here to attend\nto as well—can you truly handle\neverything at once?
When Laranoa's not here,\nlet US take care of her work!
Indeed—it's for the good of the village!
We all know how hard you work\nfor this place.
This is our chance to help you.
So please, chief, let her do what she\nwants! I'm sure she'll be just fine.
You guys... Okay, I admit I was\ngoing partly so I could goof\naround—but not anymore!
I'm more determined than ever to learn\nall I can and bring it back here.

*sigh* Very well, you may go. I had
thought you still a child, but it seems
you've grown to inspire the confidence
of your people.
Laranoa—go to the human castle.\nLearn all you can of their ways.\nThat is your new mission.
Take Rolf with you as well.\nIf everyone else has chosen to\nbelieve in you, I shall join them.
I'm gonna learn loads and loads,\nand make this village better and\nstronger than ever!
